item.title: A crinkle crankle wall is an unusual type of garden wall built in a serpentine shape typically found in the UK. It economizes on bricks because it can be made just one brick thin. If a wall this thin was made in a straight line, it would easily topple over https://t.co/ImTolQqcLC https://t.co/Olg9mbsrCD

item.content:encoded: I wish I had spent more time thinking about the Heilmeier Catechism earlier in my life (although I think I always carried it in me). https://t.co/OPI1ETW9u0 I think keeping these points in mind can help all of us scientists think clearer.

item.title: In particular, the first four points should be answered by every paper: * What are you trying to do? Articulate your objectives using absolutely no jargon. * How is it done today, and what are the limits of current practice?
item.description: In particular, the first four points should be answered by every paper: * What are you trying to do? Articulate your objectives using absolutely no jargon. * How is it done today, and what are the limits of current practice?
item.content:encoded: In particular, the first four points should be answered by every paper: * What are you trying to do? Articulate your objectives using absolutely no jargon. * How is it done today, and what are the limits of current practice?

item.title: * What is new in your approach and why do you think it will be successful? * Who cares? If you are successful, what difference will it make?
item.description: * What is new in your approach and why do you think it will be successful? * Who cares? If you are successful, what difference will it make?
item.content:encoded: * What is new in your approach and why do you think it will be successful? * Who cares? If you are successful, what difference will it make?

item.title: As best as I can tell, "attention" in the context of NLP was first called that way by Badhanau et al. (2014), but it's essentially the same mechanism used to generate conditional handwriting samples in Graves (2013), and it's contemporary with the Neural Turing machine (2014) 2/

item.title: The Neural Turing Machine paper cites a ton of cognitive science literature. Around the same time, people were experimenting with hard and soft attention in the context of visual recognition, e.g. Mnih et al. (2014). That paper cites a ton of earlier neuro, e.g. Itti & Koch 3/
item.description: The Neural Turing Machine paper cites a ton of cognitive science literature. Around the same time, people were experimenting with hard and soft attention in the context of visual recognition, e.g. Mnih et al. (2014). That paper cites a ton of earlier neuro, e.g. Itti & Koch 3/
item.content:encoded: The Neural Turing Machine paper cites a ton of cognitive science literature. Around the same time, people were experimenting with hard and soft attention in the context of visual recognition, e.g. Mnih et al. (2014). That paper cites a ton of earlier neuro, e.g. Itti & Koch 3/

item.title: So my working model of the deep lore of transformers is that they combined a bunch of ideas that were floating around seq2seq models, including intra-attention (Cheng et al. 2016), fuzzily inspired by earlier work on visual attention & working memory... 4/
